intro: Psidium lacteum, commonly known as the white guava, is a tropical shrub native to South America. It is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are usually elliptical in shape and have a slightly hairy surface. The plant produces small, white, fragrant flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its fruit is a small, round berry with a thin, white pulp that is edible but not widely cultivated for commercial use. The plant has a milky sap that can cause skin irritation in some individuals.
